qas.question: What band was the first major band to play in Latin American stadiums?
The Game Tour of the band Queen included how many shows in Argentina?
How large was Queen's record audience in Argentina?
What was the final track on Queen's The Game?
What sold out venue did Queen play in Canada?

context: In February 1981, <a0_0>Queen<a0_0/> travelled to South America as part of The Game Tour, and became the first major rock band to play in Latin American stadiums. The tour included <a1_0>five<a1_0/> shows in Argentina, one of which drew the largest single concert crowd in Argentine history with an audience of <a2_0>300,000<a2_0/> in Buenos Aires and two concerts at the Morumbi Stadium in São Paulo, Brazil, where they played to an audience of more than 131,000 people in the first night (then the largest paying audience for a single band anywhere in the world) and more than 120,000 people the following night. In October of the same year, Queen performed for more than 150,000 fans on 9 October at Monterrey (Estadio Universitario) and 17 and 18 at Puebla (Estadio Zaragoza), Mexico. On 24 and 25 November, Queen played two sell out nights at the <a4_0>Montreal Forum<a4_0/>, Quebec, Canada. One of Mercury's most notable performances of The Game's final track, "<a3_0>Save Me<a3_0/>", took place in Montreal, and the concert is recorded in the live album, Queen Rock Montreal.
